item.title: 2024 is the biggest election year in history
item.description:
Xavi Ruiz (@xruiztru) on X

2024 is the biggest election year in history! 76 states will hold elections, including: 🇮🇳 India - 1.4bn people 🇪🇺 European Union - 448m 🇺🇸 US - 342m 🇮🇩 Indonesia - 280m 🇵🇰 Pakistan- 245m 🇧🇷 Brazil - 218m 🇧🇩 Bangladesh - 175m 🇷🇺 Russia - 144m 🇲🇽 Mexico - 129m 🇹🇷 Turkey - 86m

URL: https://twitter.com/xruiztru/status/1741866530151751699

item.title: A claim that we are in a new world of RBC theory
item.description:
Gauti Eggertsson 🇺🇦 (@GautiEggertsson) on X

This is crucial to understand WHY supply shocks seem to have a much bigger effect in last few years than we have seen in the past. Conventional measures of supply shocks (see figure 17 in our paper) suggest they have NOT been large by historical standard recently. 16/

item.title: NYT calls for the total destruction of all extant major LLMs
item.description:
Daniel Jeffries (@Dan_Jeffries1) on X

The NY Times is asking that *ALL* LLMs trained on Times data be destroyed. That includes GPT 3 and 4, Claude, Mistral, Llama/Llama 2 and pretty much any other model in existence. I call on #meta, #cohere, #AnthropicAI, #MistralAI, #huggingface, #google and everyone else who…

URL: https://twitter.com/Dan_Jeffries1/status/1741053592335733196

item.title: Jim Fan (@DrJimFan) on X
item.description:
Jim Fan (@DrJimFan) on X

I’ve been asked what’s the biggest thing in 2024 other than LLMs. It’s Robotics. Period. We are ~3 years away from the ChatGPT moment for physical AI agents. We’ve been cursed by the Moravec’s paradox for too long, which is the counter-intuitive phenomenon that “tasks that humans…

item.title: AI and the Lawyer Overload
item.description:
Jean-Jacques Rousseau wrote that the Spaniards, during their conquest of the Americas, showed only one display of humanity. They did not take lawyers with them. They banned them from the colonies, and the French thinker regarded this decision as an act by which they redeemed all the crimes committed against the Indians…

URL: https://www.neonarrative.us/p/ai-and-the-lawyer-overload?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

item.title: AI #44: Copyright Confrontation
item.description:
The New York Times has thrown down the gauntlet, suing OpenAI and Microsoft for copyright infringement. Others are complaining about recreated images in the otherwise deeply awesome MidJourney v6.0. As is usually the case, the critics misunderstand the technology involved, complain about infringements that inflict no substantial damages, engineer many o…

URL: https://thezvi.substack.com/p/ai-44-copyright-confrontation?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web
